title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in win32 is using Class.forName() method.
EB: The BidiUtil class in win32 should have a private constructor. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, there is no need to instantiate it. By adding a private constructor, we prevent people from mistakenly instantiating the class. The size of the class will not be affected as the compiler already provides a default public constructor.
SR: To address this issue, change the line above to: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4). Please note that this change has not been tested, but it should have the same effect as the original code.
